response:
Hi!
Some fast notes in between talks, to answer today's questions:

I believe not one person or group carries all responsibilities, it should be shared. Not assuming others will.
Currently governments can guide and put up regulations, but eventually the layers underneath need to implement
While governments can guide the overall lines and sustainability goals. Companies/institutions decide how software is developed and run. It comes to them to implement regulations in practical ways. The persons deciding should be a collective. Get the expertise and prioritise on values.
What are financial choices, technical limits etc. And try to align them with your/governmental sustainable priorities and values.
Barriers will for sure be in waiting for others to take responsibility. Only listening to regulations but forgetting about looking at your own sustainable values for the future. Then you'll always be behind.


Sent from Outlook for iOS<https://aka.ms/o0ukef>
________________________________
From: Green Software Foundation <[REDACTED]>
Sent: Tuesday, December 9, 2025 1:14:15 PM
To: Hannah Mekke <[REDACTED]>
Subject: You’re In: Building Consensus on Software's Environmental Accountability


LET OP! Deze e-mail komt van buiten Qquest.

­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ ­ <https://foundation.us5.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ddc99c7db248c3df0ef4f7d24&id=0ba487acff&e=d7846a50e7&i=290746c613>
[https://mcusercontent.com/ddc99c7db248c3df0ef4f7d24/images/75224ba3-84f3-c950-9d5c-c8c3dec162cc.png]

Hello Hannah,


Thank you for joining the consensus-building exercise. Your expertise is exactly what we need to answer one of the most critical challenges facing our industry:

Who Should Own Software's Environmental Impact?

We’re currently on Day 1of this three-day exercise.


You've registered early, which means your insights will help shape the foundation consensus statement that hundreds of other practitioners will build upon, setting the direction for the entire conversation.


How This Works

Simply reply to this email with your views. Write as much or as little as feels right; there are no wrong answers, and what matters is your honest perspectives.


At 18:00 CET today, we'll share the first consensus statement synthesized from all responses using our AI-supported process. You'll see where agreement stands, where tensions emerge, and what questions the community is raising. Following the statement, we'll send new prompts that build on what we're learning.


Today's Questions

1: When you think about the environmental impact of software, who comes to mind as responsible for it? And why did that person or group come to mind?


2: In your experience, who is currently making decisions about the environmental impact of software? Is it the right set of people?


3: What barriers have you or your organization encountered when trying to address software's environmental impact?

Answer all the questions, a selection or use them as prompts to structure your thoughts. The more free-form the response the better. 


Reply with your views by 17:00 CET.


Your Voice Matters

No matter when you join, your insights will help refine the consensus and surface new agreements or tensions. The final report in January will reflect the full range of perspectives from all participants.


Thank you for being part of this.

The Green Software Foundation Team



Your individual responses remain private. Read the Privacy Policy & Terms of Use<https://foundation.us5.list-manage.com/track/click?u=ddc99c7db248c3df0ef4f7d24&id=f2809f6d7e&e=d7846a50e7&i=290746c613>.
